tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SocialMediaEngagement (
    post_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_content TEXT,
    engagement_likes INT,
    engagement_comments INT,
    engagement_shares INT,
    post_date TIMESTAMP,
    user_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE marketing_analysis (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id INT,
    campaign_name TEXT,
    engagement_score FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (post_id) REFERENCES social_media_engagement(id)
);

CREATE TABLE social_media_engagement (
    user_id INT,
    post_id INT,
    likes INT,
    comments INT,
    shares INT
);

CREATE TABLE user_profile (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(255),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    followers INT,
    following INT
);

CREATE TABLE Posts (
    post_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id UUID REFERENCES SocialMediaUsers(user_id),
    post_content TEXT,
    likes INT,
    comments INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE AdCampaigns (
    campaign_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    campaign_name STRING,
    target_audience STRING,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Analytics (
    analytics_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id UUID REFERENCES Posts(post_id),
    engagement_rate FLOAT,
    conversion_rate FLOAT,
    reach INT
);

CREATE TABLE social_media_accounts (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    account_name VARCHAR(255),
    followers_count INT,
    engagement_rate FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE posts (
    post_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    account_id INT,
    post_content TEXT,
    likes_count INT,
    comments_count INT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE comments (
    comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id INT,
    commenter_name VARCHAR(255),
    comment_text TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE engagements (
    engagement_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id INT,
    account_id INT,
    reaction_type ENUM('like', 'comment', 'share'),
    engagement_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE marketing_data (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    account_id INT,
    campaign_name VARCHAR(255),
    reach_count INT,
    conversion_rate FLOAT
)
